metadata.Title: CVE-2021-46671 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
options.c in atftp before 0.7.5 reads past the end of an array, and consequently discloses server-side /etc/group data to a remote client.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46671` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

atftp - 0.7.git20120829-3.1ubuntu0.1
atftpd - 0.7.git20120829-3.1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: atftp package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.7.git20120829-3.1ubuntu0.1').
